page.title: 12PARISH HALL, BERRINGTON
page.content: {The Parish Hall}in Berrington, was built in 1926 with funds raised by local people. It is timber framed with corrugated iron cladding painted green with a black roof.{The land}on which the Hall stands is leased from the Church for an annual rental of Â£1. It is run by{Berrington Room Management {Committee}who are elected members of the public and representatives of the organisations who use the Hall. It is used as the dining room for the school (Â£300pa) and is available for hire by groups or individuals. Charges vary - Meetings Â£3, Clubs and Social Events such as Bingo and Whist Drives Â£5, Dances and Parties with Bar Â£20. This {income}is barely sufficient to finance the Hall. There is concern over its future with intimations for a {Community Centre}in Cross Houses.
